description: Updates the configurations for a data source connector.

parameters.name: dataSourceConfiguration
parameters.description: The connection configuration for the data source that you want to update. confluenceConfiguration (dict) --- The configuration information to connect to Confluence as your data source. crawlerConfiguration (dict) --- The configuration of the Confluence content. For example, configuring specific types of Confluence content. filterConfiguration (dict) --- The configuration of filtering the Confluence content. For example, configuring regular expression patterns to include or exclude certain content. patternObjectFilter (dict) --- The configuration of filtering certain objects or content types of the data source. The configuration of specific filters applied to your data source content. You can filter out or include certain content. (dict) --- The specific filters applied to your data source content. exclusionFilters (list) --- A list of one or more exclusion regular expression patterns to exclude certain object types that adhere to the pattern. If you specify an inclusion and exclusion filter/pattern and both match a document, the exclusion filter takes precedence and the document isn't crawled. (string) --- inclusionFilters (list) --- A list of one or more inclusion regular expression patterns to include certain object types that adhere to the pattern. (string) --- The supported object type or content type of the data source. The type of filtering that you want to apply to certain objects or content of the data source. For example, the PATTERN type is regular expression patterns you can apply to filter your content. The endpoint information to connect to your Confluence data source. The supported authentication type to authenticate and connect to your Confluence instance. The Amazon Resource Name of an Secrets Manager secret that stores your authentication credentials for your Confluence instance URL. For more information on the key-value pairs that must be included in your secret, depending on your authentication type, see Confluence connection configuration. The supported host type, whether online/cloud or server/on-premises. The Confluence host URL or instance URL. s3Configuration (dict) --- The configuration information to connect to Amazon S3 as your data source. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 bucket that contains your data. bucketOwnerAccountId (string) --- The account ID for the owner of the S3 bucket. inclusionPrefixes (list) --- A list of S3 prefixes to include certain files or content. For more information, see Organizing objects using prefixes. (string) --- salesforceConfiguration (dict) --- The configuration information to connect to Salesforce as your data source. crawlerConfiguration (dict) --- The configuration of the Salesforce content. For example, configuring specific types of Salesforce content. filterConfiguration (dict) --- The configuration of filtering the Salesforce content. The endpoint information to connect to your Salesforce data source. The supported authentication type to authenticate and connect to your Salesforce instance. The Amazon Resource Name of an Secrets Manager secret that stores your authentication credentials for your Salesforce instance URL. For more information on the key-value pairs that must be included in your secret, depending on your authentication type, see Salesforce connection configuration. The Salesforce host URL or instance URL. sharePointConfiguration (dict) --- The configuration information to connect to SharePoint as your data source. crawlerConfiguration (dict) --- The configuration of the SharePoint content. For example, configuring specific types of SharePoint content. filterConfiguration (dict) --- The configuration of filtering the SharePoint content. The endpoint information to connect to your SharePoint data source. The supported authentication type to authenticate and connect to your SharePoint site/sites. The Amazon Resource Name of an Secrets Manager secret that stores your authentication credentials for your SharePoint site/sites. For more information on the key-value pairs that must be included in your secret, depending on your authentication type, see SharePoint connection configuration. The domain of your SharePoint instance or site URL/URLs. A list of one or more SharePoint site URLs. (string) --- tenantId (string) --- The identifier of your Microsoft 365 tenant. The type of data source. webConfiguration (dict) --- The configuration of web URLs to crawl for your data source. You should be authorized to crawl the URLs. crawlerConfiguration (dict) --- The Web Crawler configuration details for the web data source. crawlerLimits (dict) --- The configuration of crawl limits for the web URLs. maxPages (integer) --- The max number of web pages crawled from your source URLs, up to 25,000 pages. If the web pages exceed this limit, the data source sync will fail and no web pages will be ingested. rateLimit (integer) --- The max rate at which pages are crawled, up to 300 per minute per host. exclusionFilters (list) --- A list of one or more exclusion regular expression patterns to exclude certain URLs. If you specify an inclusion and exclusion filter/pattern and both match a URL, the exclusion filter takes precedence and the web content of the URL isn't crawled. (string) --- inclusionFilters (list) --- A list of one or more inclusion regular expression patterns to include certain URLs. (string) --- scope (string) --- The scope of what is crawled for your URLs. You can choose to crawl only web pages that belong to the same host or primary domain. For example, only web pages that contain the seed URL 'https://docs.aws.amazon.com/bedrock/latest/userguide/' and no other domains. You can choose to include sub domains in addition to the host or primary domain. For example, web pages that contain 'aws.amazon.com' can also include sub domain 'docs.aws.amazon.com'. userAgent (string) --- Returns the user agent suffix for your web crawler. userAgentHeader (string) --- A string used for identifying the crawler or bot when it accesses a web server. The user agent header value consists of the bedrockbot, UUID, and a user agent suffix for your crawler (if one is provided). By default, it is set to bedrockbot_UUID. You can optionally append a custom suffix to bedrockbot_UUID to allowlist a specific user agent permitted to access your source URLs. The source configuration details for the web data source. The configuration of the URL/URLs. seedUrls (list) --- One or more seed or starting point URLs. (dict) --- The seed or starting point URL. You should be authorized to crawl the URL. url (string) --- A seed or starting point URL.

nested_params.name: confluenceConfiguration
nested_params.description: The configuration information to connect to Confluence as your data source.

nested_params.name: crawlerConfiguration
nested_params.description: The configuration of the Confluence content. For example, configuring specific types of Confluence content.

nested_params.name: filterConfiguration
nested_params.description: The configuration of filtering the Confluence content. For example, configuring regular expression patterns to include or exclude certain content.

nested_params.name: patternObjectFilter
nested_params.description: The configuration of filtering certain objects or content types of the data source.

nested_params.name: filters
nested_params.description: The configuration of specific filters applied to your data source content. You can filter out or include certain content.

nested_params.name: exclusionFilters
nested_params.description: A list of one or more exclusion regular expression patterns to exclude certain object types that adhere to the pattern. If you specify an inclusion and exclusion filter/pattern and both match a document, the exclusion filter takes precedence and the document isn't crawled.

nested_params.name: inclusionFilters
nested_params.description: A list of one or more inclusion regular expression patterns to include certain object types that adhere to the pattern. If you specify an inclusion and exclusion filter/pattern and both match a document, the exclusion filter takes precedence and the document isn't crawled.

nested_params.name: objectType
nested_params.description: The supported object type or content type of the data source.

nested_params.name: type
nested_params.description: The type of filtering that you want to apply to certain objects or content of the data source. For example, the PATTERN type is regular expression patterns you can apply to filter your content.

nested_params.name: sourceConfiguration
nested_params.description: The endpoint information to connect to your Confluence data source.

nested_params.name: authType
nested_params.description: The supported authentication type to authenticate and connect to your Confluence instance.

nested_params.name: credentialsSecretArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name of an Secrets Manager secret that stores your authentication credentials for your Confluence instance URL. For more information on the key-value pairs that must be included in your secret, depending on your authentication type, see Confluence connection configuration.

nested_params.name: hostType
nested_params.description: The supported host type, whether online/cloud or server/on-premises.

nested_params.name: hostUrl
nested_params.description: The Confluence host URL or instance URL.

nested_params.name: s3Configuration
nested_params.description: The configuration information to connect to Amazon S3 as your data source.

nested_params.name: bucketArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 bucket that contains your data.

nested_params.name: bucketOwnerAccountId
nested_params.description: The account ID for the owner of the S3 bucket.

nested_params.name: inclusionPrefixes
nested_params.description: A list of S3 prefixes to include certain files or content. For more information, see Organizing objects using prefixes.

nested_params.name: filters

If you specify an inclusion and exclusion filter/pattern and both match a document, the exclusion filter takes precedence and the document isn't crawled.

If you specify an inclusion and exclusion filter/pattern and both match a document, the exclusion filter takes precedence and the document isn't crawled.

nested_params.description: The type of filtering that you want to apply to certain objects or content of the data source. For example, the PATTERN type is regular expression patterns you can apply to filter your content.

nested_params.name: authType

nested_params.name: credentialsSecretArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name of an Secrets Manager secret that stores your authentication credentials for your SharePoint site/sites. For more information on the key-value pairs that must be included in your secret, depending on your authentication type, see SharePoint connection configuration.

nested_params.name: domain
nested_params.description: The domain of your SharePoint instance or site URL/URLs.

nested_params.name: hostType
nested_params.description: The supported host type, whether online/cloud or server/on-premises.

nested_params.name: siteUrls
nested_params.description: A list of one or more SharePoint site URLs.

nested_params.name: tenantId
nested_params.description: The identifier of your Microsoft 365 tenant.

nested_params.name: type
nested_params.description: The type of data source.

nested_params.name: webConfiguration
nested_params.description: The configuration of web URLs to crawl for your data source. You should be authorized to crawl the URLs.

nested_params.name: crawlerConfiguration
nested_params.description: The Web Crawler configuration details for the web data source.

nested_params.name: crawlerLimits
nested_params.description: The configuration of crawl limits for the web URLs.

nested_params.name: maxPages
nested_params.description: The max number of web pages crawled from your source URLs, up to 25,000 pages. If the web pages exceed this limit, the data source sync will fail and no web pages will be ingested.

nested_params.name: rateLimit
nested_params.description: The max rate at which pages are crawled, up to 300 per minute per host.

nested_params.name: exclusionFilters
nested_params.description: A list of one or more exclusion regular expression patterns to exclude certain URLs. If you specify an inclusion and exclusion filter/pattern and both match a URL, the exclusion filter takes precedence and the web content of the URL isn't crawled.

nested_params.name: inclusionFilters
nested_params.description: A list of one or more inclusion regular expression patterns to include certain URLs. If you specify an inclusion and exclusion filter/pattern and both match a URL, the exclusion filter takes precedence and the web content of the URL isn't crawled.

nested_params.name: scope
nested_params.description: The scope of what is crawled for your URLs. You can choose to crawl only web pages that belong to the same host or primary domain. For example, only web pages that contain the seed URL 'https://docs.aws.amazon.com/bedrock/latest/userguide/' and no other domains. You can choose to include sub domains in addition to the host or primary domain. For example, web pages that contain 'aws.amazon.com' can also include sub domain 'docs.aws.amazon.com'.

nested_params.name: userAgent
nested_params.description: Returns the user agent suffix for your web crawler.

nested_params.name: userAgentHeader
nested_params.description: A string used for identifying the crawler or bot when it accesses a web server. The user agent header value consists of the bedrockbot, UUID, and a user agent suffix for your crawler (if one is provided). By default, it is set to bedrockbot_UUID. You can optionally append a custom suffix to bedrockbot_UUID to allowlist a specific user agent permitted to access your source URLs.

nested_params.name: sourceConfiguration
nested_params.description: The source configuration details for the web data source.

nested_params.name: urlConfiguration
nested_params.description: The configuration of the URL/URLs.

nested_params.name: seedUrls
nested_params.description: One or more seed or starting point URLs.

nested_params.name: url
nested_params.description: A seed or starting point URL.

parameters.name: dataSourceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the data source.

parameters.name: knowledgeBaseId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the knowledge base for the data source.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specifies a new name for the data source.

parameters.name: serverSideEncryptionConfiguration
parameters.description: Contains details about server-side encryption of the data source. kmsKeyArn (string) --- The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key used to encrypt the resource.

nested_params.name: kmsKeyArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key used to encrypt the resource.

parameters.name: vectorIngestionConfiguration
parameters.description: Contains details about how to ingest the documents in the data source. chunkingConfiguration (dict) --- Details about how to chunk the documents in the data source. A chunk refers to an excerpt from a data source that is returned when the knowledge base that it belongs to is queried. Knowledge base can split your source data into chunks. You have the following options for chunking your data. If you opt for NONE, then you may want to pre-process your files by splitting them up such that each file corresponds to a chunk. FIXED_SIZE --- Amazon Bedrock splits your source data into chunks of the approximate size that you set in the fixedSizeChunkingConfiguration. HIERARCHICAL --- Split documents into layers of chunks where the first layer contains large chunks, and the second layer contains smaller chunks derived from the first layer. SEMANTIC --- Split documents into chunks based on groups of similar content derived with natural language processing. NONE --- Amazon Bedrock treats each file as one chunk. If you choose this option, you may want to pre-process your documents by splitting them into separate files. fixedSizeChunkingConfiguration (dict) --- Configurations for when you choose fixed-size chunking. If you set the chunkingStrategy as NONE, exclude this field. The maximum number of tokens to include in a chunk. The percentage of overlap between adjacent chunks of a data source. hierarchicalChunkingConfiguration (dict) --- Settings for hierarchical document chunking for a data source. Hierarchical chunking splits documents into layers of chunks where the first layer contains large chunks, and the second layer contains smaller chunks derived from the first layer. Token settings for each layer. (dict) --- Token settings for a layer in a hierarchical chunking configuration. The maximum number of tokens that a chunk can contain in this layer. The number of tokens to repeat across chunks in the same layer. semanticChunkingConfiguration (dict) --- Settings for semantic document chunking for a data source. Semantic chunking splits a document into into smaller documents based on groups of similar content derived from the text with natural language processing. The dissimilarity threshold for splitting chunks. The buffer size. The maximum number of tokens that a chunk can contain. contextEnrichmentConfiguration (dict) --- The context enrichment configuration used for ingestion of the data into the vector store. bedrockFoundationModelConfiguration (dict) --- The configuration of the Amazon Bedrock foundation model used for context enrichment. The enrichment stategy used to provide additional context. For example, Neptune GraphRAG uses Amazon Bedrock foundation models to perform chunk entity extraction. The method used for the context enrichment strategy. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the foundation model used for context enrichment. The method used for context enrichment. It must be Amazon Bedrock foundation models. customTransformationConfiguration (dict) --- A custom document transformer for parsed data source documents. An S3 bucket path for input and output objects. An S3 bucket path. The location's URI. For example, s3://my-bucket/chunk-processor/. A Lambda function that processes documents. (dict) --- A custom processing step for documents moving through a data source ingestion pipeline. To process documents after they have been converted into chunks, set the step to apply to POST_CHUNKING. When the service applies the transformation. The Lambda function. The function's ARN identifier. parsingConfiguration (dict) --- Configurations for a parser to use for parsing documents in your data source. If you exclude this field, the default parser will be used. bedrockDataAutomationConfiguration (dict) --- If you specify BEDROCK_DATA_AUTOMATION as the parsing strategy for ingesting your data source, use this object to modify configurations for using the Amazon Bedrock Data Automation parser. parsingModality (string) --- Specifies whether to enable parsing of multimodal data, including both text and/or images. bedrockFoundationModelConfiguration (dict) --- If you specify BEDROCK_FOUNDATION_MODEL as the parsing strategy for ingesting your data source, use this object to modify configurations for using a foundation model to parse documents. The ARN of the foundation model to use for parsing. parsingPrompt (dict) --- Instructions for interpreting the contents of a document. Instructions for interpreting the contents of a document. The parsing strategy for the data source.

nested_params.name: chunkingConfiguration
nested_params.description: Details about how to chunk the documents in the data source. A chunk refers to an excerpt from a data source that is returned when the knowledge base that it belongs to is queried.

nested_params.name: chunkingStrategy
nested_params.description: Knowledge base can split your source data into chunks. A chunk refers to an excerpt from a data source that is returned when the knowledge base that it belongs to is queried. You have the following options for chunking your data. If you opt for NONE, then you may want to pre-process your files by splitting them up such that each file corresponds to a chunk.

nested_params.name: fixedSizeChunkingConfiguration
nested_params.description: Configurations for when you choose fixed-size chunking. If you set the chunkingStrategy as NONE, exclude this field.

nested_params.name: maxTokens
nested_params.description: The maximum number of tokens to include in a chunk.

nested_params.name: overlapPercentage
nested_params.description: The percentage of overlap between adjacent chunks of a data source.

nested_params.name: hierarchicalChunkingConfiguration
nested_params.description: Settings for hierarchical document chunking for a data source. Hierarchical chunking splits documents into layers of chunks where the first layer contains large chunks, and the second layer contains smaller chunks derived from the first layer.

nested_params.name: levelConfigurations
nested_params.description: Token settings for each layer.

nested_params.name: maxTokens
nested_params.description: The maximum number of tokens that a chunk can contain in this layer.

nested_params.name: overlapTokens
nested_params.description: The number of tokens to repeat across chunks in the same layer.

nested_params.name: semanticChunkingConfiguration
nested_params.description: Settings for semantic document chunking for a data source. Semantic chunking splits a document into into smaller documents based on groups of similar content derived from the text with natural language processing.

nested_params.name: breakpointPercentileThreshold
nested_params.description: The dissimilarity threshold for splitting chunks.

nested_params.name: bufferSize
nested_params.description: The buffer size.

nested_params.name: maxTokens
nested_params.description: The maximum number of tokens that a chunk can contain.

nested_params.name: contextEnrichmentConfiguration
nested_params.description: The context enrichment configuration used for ingestion of the data into the vector store.

nested_params.name: bedrockFoundationModelConfiguration
nested_params.description: The configuration of the Amazon Bedrock foundation model used for context enrichment.

nested_params.name: enrichmentStrategyConfiguration
nested_params.description: The enrichment stategy used to provide additional context. For example, Neptune GraphRAG uses Amazon Bedrock foundation models to perform chunk entity extraction.

nested_params.name: method
nested_params.description: The method used for the context enrichment strategy.

nested_params.name: modelArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the foundation model used for context enrichment.

nested_params.name: type
nested_params.description: The method used for context enrichment. It must be Amazon Bedrock foundation models.

nested_params.name: customTransformationConfiguration
nested_params.description: A custom document transformer for parsed data source documents.

nested_params.name: intermediateStorage
nested_params.description: An S3 bucket path for input and output objects.

nested_params.name: s3Location
nested_params.description: An S3 bucket path.

nested_params.name: uri
nested_params.description: The location's URI. For example, s3://my-bucket/chunk-processor/.

nested_params.name: transformations
nested_params.description: A Lambda function that processes documents.

nested_params.name: stepToApply
nested_params.description: When the service applies the transformation.

nested_params.name: transformationFunction
nested_params.description: A Lambda function that processes documents.

nested_params.name: transformationLambdaConfiguration
nested_params.description: The Lambda function.

nested_params.name: lambdaArn
nested_params.description: The function's ARN identifier.

nested_params.name: parsingConfiguration
nested_params.description: Configurations for a parser to use for parsing documents in your data source. If you exclude this field, the default parser will be used.

nested_params.name: bedrockDataAutomationConfiguration
nested_params.description: If you specify BEDROCK_DATA_AUTOMATION as the parsing strategy for ingesting your data source, use this object to modify configurations for using the Amazon Bedrock Data Automation parser.

nested_params.name: parsingModality
nested_params.description: Specifies whether to enable parsing of multimodal data, including both text and/or images.

nested_params.name: bedrockFoundationModelConfiguration
nested_params.description: If you specify BEDROCK_FOUNDATION_MODEL as the parsing strategy for ingesting your data source, use this object to modify configurations for using a foundation model to parse documents.

nested_params.name: modelArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the foundation model to use for parsing.

nested_params.name: parsingModality
nested_params.description: Specifies whether to enable parsing of multimodal data, including both text and/or images.

nested_params.name: parsingPrompt
nested_params.description: Instructions for interpreting the contents of a document.

nested_params.name: parsingPromptText
nested_params.description: Instructions for interpreting the contents of a document.

nested_params.name: parsingStrategy
nested_params.description: The parsing strategy for the data source.

nested_items.description: The configuration information to connect to SharePoint as your data source.

nested_items.name: crawlerConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration of the SharePoint content. For example, configuring specific types of SharePoint content.

nested_items.name: filterConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration of filtering the SharePoint content. For example, configuring regular expression patterns to include or exclude certain content.

nested_items.name: patternObjectFilter
nested_items.description: The configuration of filtering certain objects or content types of the data source.

nested_items.name: filters
nested_items.description: The configuration of specific filters applied to your data source content. You can filter out or include certain content.

nested_items.name: exclusionFilters
nested_items.description: A list of one or more exclusion regular expression patterns to exclude certain object types that adhere to the pattern. If you specify an inclusion and exclusion filter/pattern and both match a document, the exclusion filter takes precedence and the document isn't crawled.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: inclusionFilters
nested_items.description: A list of one or more inclusion regular expression patterns to include certain object types that adhere to the pattern. If you specify an inclusion and exclusion filter/pattern and both match a document, the exclusion filter takes precedence and the document isn't crawled.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: objectType
nested_items.description: The supported object type or content type of the data source.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of filtering that you want to apply to certain objects or content of the data source. For example, the PATTERN type is regular expression patterns you can apply to filter your content.

nested_items.name: sourceConfiguration
nested_items.description: The endpoint information to connect to your SharePoint data source.

nested_items.name: authType
nested_items.description: The supported authentication type to authenticate and connect to your SharePoint site/sites.

nested_items.name: credentialsSecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name of an Secrets Manager secret that stores your authentication credentials for your SharePoint site/sites. For more information on the key-value pairs that must be included in your secret, depending on your authentication type, see SharePoint connection configuration.

nested_items.name: domain
nested_items.description: The domain of your SharePoint instance or site URL/URLs.

nested_items.name: hostType
nested_items.description: The supported host type, whether online/cloud or server/on-premises.

nested_items.name: siteUrls
nested_items.description: A list of one or more SharePoint site URLs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: tenantId
nested_items.description: The identifier of your Microsoft 365 tenant.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of data source.

nested_items.name: webConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration of web URLs to crawl for your data source. You should be authorized to crawl the URLs.

nested_items.name: crawlerConfiguration
nested_items.description: The Web Crawler configuration details for the web data source.

nested_items.name: crawlerLimits
nested_items.description: The configuration of crawl limits for the web URLs.

nested_items.name: maxPages
nested_items.description: The max number of web pages crawled from your source URLs, up to 25,000 pages. If the web pages exceed this limit, the data source sync will fail and no web pages will be ingested.

nested_items.name: rateLimit
nested_items.description: The max rate at which pages are crawled, up to 300 per minute per host.

nested_items.name: exclusionFilters
nested_items.description: A list of one or more exclusion regular expression patterns to exclude certain URLs. If you specify an inclusion and exclusion filter/pattern and both match a URL, the exclusion filter takes precedence and the web content of the URL isn't crawled.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: inclusionFilters
nested_items.description: A list of one or more inclusion regular expression patterns to include certain URLs. If you specify an inclusion and exclusion filter/pattern and both match a URL, the exclusion filter takes precedence and the web content of the URL isn't crawled.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: scope
nested_items.description: The scope of what is crawled for your URLs.

nested_items.name: userAgent
nested_items.description: Returns the user agent suffix for your web crawler.

nested_items.name: userAgentHeader
nested_items.description: A string used for identifying the crawler or bot when it accesses a web server. The user agent header value consists of the bedrockbot, UUID, and a user agent suffix for your crawler (if one is provided). By default, it is set to bedrockbot_UUID. You can optionally append a custom suffix to bedrockbot_UUID to allowlist a specific user agent permitted to access your source URLs.

nested_items.name: sourceConfiguration
nested_items.description: The source configuration details for the web data source.

nested_items.name: urlConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration of the URL/URLs.

nested_items.name: seedUrls
nested_items.description: One or more seed or starting point URLs.

nested_items.name: url
nested_items.description: A seed or starting point URL.

nested_items.name: dataSourceId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the data source.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the data source.

nested_items.name: failureReasons
nested_items.description: The detailed reasons on the failure to delete a data source.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: knowledgeBaseId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the knowledge base to which the data source belongs.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the data source.

nested_items.name: serverSideEncryptionConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains details about the configuration of the server-side encryption.

nested_items.name: kmsKeyArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key used to encrypt the resource.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the data source. The following statuses are possible:
Available --- The data source has been created and is ready for ingestion into the knowledge base.
Deleting --- The data source is being deleted.

nested_items.name: updatedAt
nested_items.description: The time at which the data source was last updated.

nested_items.name: vectorIngestionConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains details about how to ingest the documents in the data source.

nested_items.name: chunkingConfiguration
nested_items.description: Details about how to chunk the documents in the data source. A chunk refers to an excerpt from a data source that is returned when the knowledge base that it belongs to is queried.

nested_items.name: chunkingStrategy
nested_items.description: Knowledge base can split your source data into chunks. A chunk refers to an excerpt from a data source that is returned when the knowledge base that it belongs to is queried. You have the following options for chunking your data. If you opt for NONE, then you may want to pre-process your files by splitting them up such that each file corresponds to a chunk.
FIXED_SIZE --- Amazon Bedrock splits your source data into chunks of the approximate size that you set in the fixedSizeChunkingConfiguration.
HIERARCHICAL --- Split documents into layers of chunks where the first layer contains large chunks, and the second layer contains smaller chunks derived from the first layer.
SEMANTIC --- Split documents into chunks based on groups of similar content derived with natural language processing.
NONE --- Amazon Bedrock treats each file as one chunk. If you choose this option, you may want to pre-process your documents by splitting them into separate files.

nested_items.name: fixedSizeChunkingConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configurations for when you choose fixed-size chunking. If you set the chunkingStrategy as NONE, exclude this field.

nested_items.name: maxTokens
nested_items.description: The maximum number of tokens to include in a chunk.

nested_items.name: overlapPercentage
nested_items.description: The percentage of overlap between adjacent chunks of a data source.

nested_items.name: hierarchicalChunkingConfiguration
nested_items.description: Settings for hierarchical document chunking for a data source. Hierarchical chunking splits documents into layers of chunks where the first layer contains large chunks, and the second layer contains smaller chunks derived from the first layer.

nested_items.name: levelConfigurations
nested_items.description: Token settings for each layer.

nested_items.name: maxTokens
nested_items.description: The maximum number of tokens that a chunk can contain in this layer.

nested_items.name: overlapTokens
nested_items.description: The number of tokens to repeat across chunks in the same layer.

nested_items.name: semanticChunkingConfiguration
nested_items.description: Settings for semantic document chunking for a data source. Semantic chunking splits a document into into smaller documents based on groups of similar content derived from the text with natural language processing.

nested_items.name: breakpointPercentileThreshold
nested_items.description: The dissimilarity threshold for splitting chunks.

nested_items.name: bufferSize
nested_items.description: The buffer size.

nested_items.name: maxTokens
nested_items.description: The maximum number of tokens that a chunk can contain.

nested_items.name: contextEnrichmentConfiguration
nested_items.description: The context enrichment configuration used for ingestion of the data into the vector store.

nested_items.name: bedrockFoundationModelConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration of the Amazon Bedrock foundation model used for context enrichment.

nested_items.name: enrichmentStrategyConfiguration
nested_items.description: The enrichment stategy used to provide additional context. For example, Neptune GraphRAG uses Amazon Bedrock foundation models to perform chunk entity extraction.

nested_items.name: method
nested_items.description: The method used for the context enrichment strategy.

nested_items.name: modelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the foundation model used for context enrichment.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The method used for context enrichment. It must be Amazon Bedrock foundation models.

nested_items.name: customTransformationConfiguration
nested_items.description: A custom document transformer for parsed data source documents.

nested_items.name: intermediateStorage
nested_items.description: An S3 bucket path for input and output objects.

nested_items.name: s3Location
nested_items.description: An S3 bucket path.

nested_items.name: uri
nested_items.description: The location's URI. For example, s3://my-bucket/chunk-processor/.

nested_items.name: transformations
nested_items.description: A Lambda function that processes documents.

nested_items.name: stepToApply
nested_items.description: When the service applies the transformation.

nested_items.name: transformationFunction
nested_items.description: A Lambda function that processes documents.

nested_items.name: transformationLambdaConfiguration
nested_items.description: The Lambda function.

nested_items.name: lambdaArn
nested_items.description: The function's ARN identifier.

nested_items.name: parsingConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configurations for a parser to use for parsing documents in your data source. If you exclude this field, the default parser will be used.

nested_items.name: bedrockDataAutomationConfiguration
nested_items.description: If you specify BEDROCK_DATA_AUTOMATION as the parsing strategy for ingesting your data source, use this object to modify configurations for using the Amazon Bedrock Data Automation parser.

nested_items.name: parsingModality
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to enable parsing of multimodal data, including both text and/or images.

nested_items.name: bedrockFoundationModelConfiguration
nested_items.description: If you specify BEDROCK_FOUNDATION_MODEL as the parsing strategy for ingesting your data source, use this object to modify configurations for using a foundation model to parse documents.

nested_items.name: modelArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the foundation model to use for parsing.

nested_items.name: parsingModality
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to enable parsing of multimodal data, including both text and/or images.

nested_items.name: parsingPrompt
nested_items.description: Instructions for interpreting the contents of a document.

nested_items.name: parsingPromptText
nested_items.description: Instructions for interpreting the contents of a document.

nested_items.name: parsingStrategy
nested_items.description: The parsing strategy for the data source.
